info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:18PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Putnam and southern Bureau Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 217 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over McNabb, or 7 miles southeast of Hennepin, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Putnam and southern Bureau Counties, including the following locations... Putnam and Standard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
